input: Anne is cold. Anne is kind. Anne is round. Dave is big. Dave is young. Gary is green. Harry is young. Kind things are cold. If Dave is big then Dave is kind. If something is young then it is cold. Round, cold things are big. All kind, young things are smart. Kind, green things are round. Young, round things are green. If Harry is young and Harry is cold then Harry is green. Young, green things are kind. Question: Harry is not big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Anne : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Cold : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Cold Anne
axiom T2 : Kind Anne
axiom T3 : Round Anne
axiom T4 : Big Dave
axiom T5 : Young Dave
axiom T6 : Green Gary
axiom T7 : Young Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Cold x
axiom R2 : Big Dave → Kind Dave
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Young x → Cold x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Round x ∧ Cold x → Big x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Young x → Smart x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Green x → Round x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ Round x → Green x
axiom R8 : Young Harry ∧ Cold Harry → Green Harry
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Young x ∧ Green x → Kind x

theorem harry_is_not_big : ¬ Big Harry :=
begin
  sorry
end

-- Looks like it cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Harry is big

theorem harry_is_big : Big Harry :=
begin
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R6,
  split,
  apply R9,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R8,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R3,
  exact T7,
  apply R3,
  exact T7,
end

-- It can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
